section.title: Overview
section.para: This module implements an User Agent capable of establishing messaging sessions using the MSRP(RFC 4976) protocol.
Through an internal API and exported script and MI functions, the module allows Marina.Rodeo to set up MSRP sessions via SIP and exchange messages as an MSRP endpoint.
The module makes use of the proto_msrp module for the MSRP protocol stack and the b2b_entities module for the SIP UAC/UAS functionalities.

section.xreflabel: Usage from Script and External API
section.title: Usage from Script and External API
section.para: In order to start a SIP call carying MSRP from Marina.Rodeo you can use the MI function. Alternatively, to answer a SIP session with MSRP you can use the script function.
When a UAC or UAS session is successfully established(ACK sent/received) the event is triggered. After this point, you may receive MSRP messages or Reports, signaled by the and events.

Note that the E_MSRP_REPORT_RECEIVED event covers both actual MSRP REPORT requests as well as negative MSRP transaction responses and local send timeouts(which should be treated the same as a received timeout transaction response).
You can send MSRP messages to the peer with the MI function.

section.title: &osips; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
proto_msrp
b2b_entities

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para: The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &osips; with this module loaded:

listitem.para: None.

section.title: hash_size (int)
section.para: The size of the hash table that stores the MSRP session information. It is the 2 logarithmic value of the real size.

Default value is 10
(1024 records).

section.title: cleanup_interval (int)
section.para: The interval between full iterations of the sessions table in order to clean up expired MSRP sessions.

section.title: max_duration (integer)
section.para: The maximum duration of a call. If set to 0, there will be no limitation.
The default value is 12 * 3600 seconds (12 hours).

section.title: my_uri (string)
section.para: The MSRP URI of the Marina.Rodeo endpoint. This URI will be advertised in the SDP offer provided to peers when setting up a session and should match one of the MSRP listeners defined in the script.
The session-id part of the URI should be ommited.
If the port is not set explicitly, the default value of 2855 wil be assumed

section.title: advertised_contact (string)
section.para: Contact to be used in the generated SIP requests. For sessions answered by Marina.Rodeo, if it is not set, it is constructed dynamically from the socket where the initiating request was received.
This parameter is mandatory when using the MI function.

section.title: relay_uri (string)
section.para: URI of an MSRP relay to use for both accepted and initiated sessions.
Credentials for the MSRP client are provided via the uac_auth module by setting the credential module parameter.
If not set, no relay will be used.
This functions answers an initial INVITE offering a new MSRP messaging session. After this function is used to initialize the session, the call will be completely handled by the B2B engine.

Parameters:
content_types (string) - content types adevertised in the accept-types SDP attribute. At least one of the content types in this list must match the types offered by the peer in its SDP offer.
This function can be used only from a request route.
Sends a new MSRP message to the peer.
Name: msrp_ua_send_message
Parameters

listitem.para: session_id (string) - the MSRP session identifier ("session-id" part of the MSRP URI).
mime (string, optional) - MIME content type of this message. If missing, an empty message will be sent.
body (string, optional) - actual message body. If missing, an empty message will be sent.

success_report (string, optional) - string indicating whether to request an MSRP Success Report. Possible values are yes or no. If the parameter is missing or is set to "no" the SEND request will not include a Success-Report header.

failure_report (string, optional) - string indicating whether to request an MSRP Failure Report. Possible values are yes, no or partial, as specified in MSRP. If the parameter is missing or is set to "yes" the SEND request will not include a Failure-Report header. Note that if the header field is not present, the receving MSRP endpoint must treat it the same as a Failure-Report header with a value of "yes".

section.para: MI FIFO Command Format:
section.programlisting: Marina.Rodeo-cli -x mi msrp_ua_send_message \ session_id=5addd9e7b74fa44fbace68a4fc562293 \ mime=text/plain body=Hello success_report=yes

section.para: Starts a MSRP session.
The is mandatory if this function is used.
Name: msrp_ua_start_session
Parameters

listitem.para: content_types (string) - content types adevertised in the accept-types SDP attribute.
from_uri (string) - From URI to be used in the INVITE.
to_uri (string) - To URI to be used in the INVITE.
ruri (string) - Request URI and destination of the INVITE.

section.para: MI FIFO Command Format:
section.programlisting: Marina.Rodeo-cli -x mi msrp_ua_start_session \ text/plain sip:oss@Marina.Rodeo.org \ sip:alice@Marina.Rodeo.org sip:alice@Marina.Rodeo.org

section.para: Lists information about ongoing MSRP sessions.
Name: msrp_ua_list_sessions
Parameters

listitem.para: None.

section.para: MI FIFO Command Format:
Terminate an ongoing MSRP session.
Name: msrp_ua_end_session
Parameters

listitem.para: session_id (string) - the MSRP session identifier ("session-id" part of the MSRP URI).

section.para: MI FIFO Command Format:
This event is triggered when a new MSRP session is successfully established(ACK sent/received).
Parameters:

listitem.para: from_uri - The URI in the SIP From header of the answered INVITE.
to_uri - The URI in the SIP To header of the answered INVITE.
ruri - The SIP Request URI of the answered INVITE.
session_id - The MSRP session identifier ("session-id" part of the MSRP URI).
content_types - The content types offered by the peer in the accept-types SDP attribute.

section.para: This event is triggered when an ongoing MSRP session is terminted (session expires or BYE is received; terminating a session via the msrp_ua_end_session MI function is not included).
Parameters:

listitem.para: session_id - The MSRP session identifier ("session-id" part of the MSRP URI).

section.para: This event is triggered when receiving a new, non-empty MSRP SEND request from the peer.
Parameters:

listitem.para: session_id - The MSRP session identifier ("session-id" part of the MSRP URI).
content_type - The content type of this message.
body - The actual message body.

section.para:
This event is triggered when:
a MSRP REPORT request is received
a failure transaction response is received
a local timeout for a SEND request occured.
Parameters:

listitem.para: session_id - The MSRP session identifier ("session-id" part of the MSRP URI).
message_id - The value of the Message-ID header field.
status - The value of the Status header field.
byte_range - The value of the Byte-Range header field.
